news_header: Study reveals Christopher Columbus was a Western European Sephardian.
news_text: A recent study in Spain aimed to clarify the origins of explorer Christopher Columbus, revealing through DNA analysis that he was a Western European Sephardian. This finding contributes to the ongoing debate about Columbus's heritage and burial location, as he is interred in the Cathedral of Seville. Columbus, who undertook voyages funded by Spain in the 1490s, played a significant role in European exploration of America. The Sephardite Jews, from regions of Spain and Portugal, are part of the Jewish Diaspora.
